project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Recently, we've been seeing sundry JS errors in the Rapid Boards, and we don't find a lot in the way of troubleshooting information either in the GUI pop-up or in the atlassian-jira.log and atlassian-greenhopper.log files. More information provided, especially if it can be recorded in the server's logs, would be very helpful.

This affects SAC as well.
fields.summary: As a Supporter, I want improved Rapid Board JS error reporting

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a greenhopper user I would like to have the option to chose the 'Epic Name' as 'required' or 'optional', but 'Epic name' field is locked, as a user we can't edit this custom field.

In some user case, users don't want to use the 'Epic name' field but it's always required, no epic issue can be created without fill in the 'Epic Name'. Therefore, the 'Epic name' will also show up at the 'view issue screen', which is annoying when user doesn't need it.

Thanks
fields.summary: As a greenhopper user I would like to have the option to chose the 'Epic Name' as 'required' or 'optional'

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Expander on epic should not select epic

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a project admin I would like to be able to "split" an existing sprint on the planning board into multiple sprints to save time and effort when rescheduling lots of tickets.
Or in other words: I would like to be able to insert a new sprint in between two existing (planned) sprints.

At the moment we have quite a few sprints already planned for the future (sometimes > 10), but they are constantly refined up until the moment when we start the actual sprint. This leads to situations where we need to do some major re-prioritization or reshuffling of tickets.
Right now we can only manually achieve this by adding a new sprint at the end of the planning board, dragging all items from the previously last sprint to the newly created sprint, and then move the tickets from prior sprints one sprint down respectively. Also we need to manually update the names of all previously scheduled sprints accordingly.
In order to save time it would be great if we could automate this task by inserting new sprints in the middle or splitting existing sprints.
fields.summary: Split Sprint / Insert new Sprint

fields.description:
A ticket about a problem in GreenHopper's Burnup Gadget has been raised and marked as "Won't Fix". We would like at least to advise our customer's in GreenHopper's documentation about this problem.

Summarizing the bug:

When changing the workflow scheme of a Project, the Burnup Gadget that is using the project will break information and show incorrect data. Here is the bug report for the complete explanation about the bug: 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-7683

Please improve the documentation, as customer's will be advised about the problem in our documentation before facing the bug (since it's not going to be implemented).
fields.summary: Modify GreenHopper Docs to advise customers about GHS-7683

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When navigating to a board *after* viewing the Agile Wallboard Gadget with a quick filter applied, the quick filter will also be applied to the board without any visible highlighting to show that a quick filter is applied. Clicking on the quick filter itself will *unapply* the quick filter, although it will now be highlighted as if it were selected. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board (Kanban or Scrum)
# Create 4 issues, and assign 3 to yourself. Leave one unassigned or assigned to someone else. 
# Create a Dashboard. 
# Add the Agile Wallboard Gadget and configure it with the created board and the 'Only My Issues' Quick Filter selected. 
# If the board is a scrum board, create and start 1 sprint with all 4 issues in it. Otherwise, skip to the next step. 
# View the Dashboard. 
# Navigate back to the board. 

h3. Expected Results

The board is displayed with no quick filter applied.  All 4 issues display. 

h3. Actual Results
The board is displayed *with* the quick filter applied but without any visible evidence that it is (all quick filters unhighlighted). Only the 3 issues assigned to yourself are shown. The quick filter is displayed in the URL (i.e. http://localhost:47212/j7212/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&quickFilter=1).  Clicking on the quick filter will highlight it as if it's applied but will actually *unapply* it. The quick filter parameter is also removed from the URL so it appears that it's not filtered (http://localhost:47212/j7212/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1). 

This causes confusion as there is no clear way to know if there is a quick filter applied and/or remove it. 
 
h3.Workaround
Refresh the page. 

=============
h3. Original Description
I have an Agile board (Kanban style) defined for our project.

I also have the Greenhopper Wallboard Gadget included on my Dashboard.

I have configured my Wallboard Gadget to activate one of the Agile board's Quick Filters, for example, the "Only my issues" Quick Filter.

When I display the actual Agile board, the Quick Filter selected for the gadget is active on the Agile board, but the corresponding Quick Filter button is shown as inactive.

Selecting that Quick Filter now turns the filter OFF, but displays ON.

Using the browser's reload will sync the state of the Quick Filter and the displayed state of the button.

I am using chromium-browser Version 27.0.1425.0 on Linux, but I have seen this behavior in other browsers.
fields.summary: Quick filter selected for Agile Wallboard Gadget is also selected for the actual board, but the state is shown unselected

fields.description:
Repro:
# - create a project
# - create a sprint
# - create an issue and add it to the sprint
# - set remaining estimate on the issue
# - start the sprint
# - log some work against the issue
# - log some more work against the issue
# - go into JIRA, edit the first work log, and change the time remaining
# - view the sprint report
# - compare to time remaining in JIRA

They are not consistent
fields.summary: Total time remaining is incorrect if user edits the work log and sets Remaining Estimate manually

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
There should be an option to prevent someone from logging work on an issue not assigned to the active sprint.

*OR*

There should be an (optional) feature to automatically move an issue into the Sprint when someone attempts to log work on it.


The latter solution would be very useful for Support or Operations teams. In fact, it would remove 90% of the work that team members spend on tracking their issues. 

Yes, this absolutely takes the sprint from a pure planning into a reactive mode, but it properly handles how support and operations teams use it.
fields.summary: Automatically move tickets into Sprint, or prevent work logged on tickets not in Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We do internally developed software capitalization, and our time tracking must align to the epics teams are working on (in our world, epic=project).  Because of this, we require all issues to be tagged to an epic.  Sub-tasks cannot be viewed in the Plan mode, and therefore cannot be tagged to the epic.  In addition, when I create a sub-task, it is not inheriting the Epic link from the parent.

This causes our time reporting to create orphaned hours for sub-tasks which have no epic.

Please expose the sub-tasks in plan (or make it configurable), or ensure the epic link field inherits the epic attributes of it's parent!
fields.summary: As a PMO manager, I need for sub-tasks to inherit the epic link of their parent, to ensure that my time tracking reporting accurately rolls all issues and hours up to the epic correctly.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The new Planning board supports a single backlog.

For the purposes of release planning, one or more release backlogs can be very useful.

Release backlogs can *almost* be supported in the current board simply by naming a sprint after a release. During planning on the Planning board, we can drag stories among the product backlog, the release backlogs, and sprints. 

The only thing that is missing is this - we would like to create new sprints for a release above its release backlog. However, the current Planning board does not allow the creation of a new sprint above another, nor does it allow sprints to be reordered. Consequently, to create a new sprint for a release, we're reduced to: create a new sprint above the product backlog, and then manually shift all the stories in each sprint to the sprint below and rename each sprint.

Please consider supporting release backlogs in addition to the product backlog.
fields.summary: Release backlogs

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It's great having the plan mode when adding items to a sprint; but, I need the ability to directly add an item to a sprint upon creation.  The issue is that when testing, the team will find bugs that need to be fixed during the development sprint.  But, they don't automatically get added to a sprint; you have to go back to the plan mode and add them into the sprint.  The latter isn't efficient since you need to be an administrator for managing the sprints and not appropriate for all QAs and Devs to have.  The PO should not have to be involved in every decision regarding bugs identified during unit and functional testing.  

If you add them now via JIRA, they actually don't get captured correctly and your reporting on the issues found during that sprint are not valid. You also easily lose sight of them as they don't appear on your board.
fields.summary: As a user, I need to be able to set the sprint when creating an issue in JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the Parallel Sprints feature in GH Labs, nice feature but our teams would like to run a few parallel sprints against one project, and report these independently, however the program team needs to be able to combine some metrics from selected sprints that are date agnostic. The sprints may not always start and stop on the same date, but they have a day zero and a day 14, and would be nice to report out how the teams combined performance has been, overall completion rate, time spent, estimates, etc.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to select which parallel sprints to create a merged report from

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When creating a Task and then creating Sub-Tasks beneath it, the Remaining value is properly populated with the total number of hours estimated for the Sub-Tasks.  However, the Estmate field is left blank (shoudln't it contain the sum of the Estimate values for the Sub-Tasks?).  This makes Sprint Planning a little difficult since the Remaining and Estimate values on the Sprint Plan don't match.  It also makes tracking a little more dificult because it is harder to compare the initial Estimate with the Remaining value during Sprint execution.
fields.summary: Greenhopper not populating Estimate field with sum total of Estimates from Sub-Tasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If you take an issue that is in the current sprint backlog of project A and move it to project B it creates a variety of problems. When you look at the scrum board for project B you will see the sprint name from project A listed in the sprint filter list.

We are seeing a variety of serious issues with sprints that might be caused by this but we can't be sure. We have had sprints in different project using the same sprint ID. We then had sprints in a project get closed or deleted when sprints with the shared ID in other projects are either closed or deleted. It is creating a great deal of havoc. The only thing we have repro'd reliably is appears of sprint filters across scrum boards.

Repro:
Create projects A and B, each with their own scrum boards and backlogs
Create Project A Sprint 1 and Project B Sprint 1 in the respective boards.
Add stories to the sprint backlog for project A and start the sprint
Move a story that is in the current sprint of project A to project B
View the board for project B

Results:
Project A Sprint 1 should be listed on the board for Project B.

*Workaround*

Remove the issue from the Sprint it is in before moving it to the new project. This can also be done after it is moved by looking at Plan Mode, right-clicking the issue, and choosing "Remove from Sprint".
fields.summary: Moving an issue from a current sprint in one project to the backlog of another project causes the sprint from the first project to show up on scrum board of the second project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Today expired our license for GreenHopper. From today GreenHopper is {color:red}*not working!*{color} When we click on the main menu on "Agile" Jira does not appear to Greenhoper dashboard, but redirects us to jira Plugin management.

GreenHopper is {color:red}*very critical*{color} to our business. Our projects are affected. Please what is the fastest solution. We need to work GreenHopper ASAP.


And what is the status "License is for an older version and maintenance has expired". I don't understand this.

{code}
Installed version: 6.1.4
Available version: 6.1.5
Developer: Atlassian
Add-on key: com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira
License details: Unlimited-user commercial license, Standard, expires 28.03.2013
License status: License is for an older version and maintenance has expired
License SEN: SEN-2240831 
{code}

Regards

Martin Kostal
DERS s.r.o.
Czech Republic

*Workaround*

After updating to UPM 2.1.1+ (either 2.1.1 or 2.1.2 would contain the fix), your GreenHopper may still report itself as having a maintenance-expired license. This is because plugin licenses get cached and are only recomputed once a day.
To refresh your cached GreenHopper license you can do the following:
Copy your GreenHopper license in your UPM (Plugin Manager)
Remove the GreenHopper license in your UPM such that it says it is unlicensed
Paste (re-enter) the GreenHopper license and submit it.
By doing the workaround you described above, you essentially did the same thing.
fields.summary: Not working plugin with expired license

Any other users would be able to move issues into sprints as long as said sprints have not been started.

Is there a way to do this?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
How sub-tasks are not always ideal. Example:
"https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/108172/planning-sprint-in-greenhopper-6-with-scrum-board-no-subtasks-shown". 

1) Not everyone's workflow matches your ideal, JIRA is really powerful and should allow us to hang ourselves if we want to.

We should be able to estimate points on subtasks and have those points roll up to their parent stories. This should be our teams choice if we want to configure JIRA this way, not yours.

At the very least the plan view should show subtasks without having to click on a story. I'm ok with the sub-tasks following the parent story when you move it, but having the sub-tasks show is very important for our team's work flow and how we estimate the parents stories work. The current implementation leaves a lot to be desired.
fields.summary: Improve how sub tasks are handled in GH.

However if I have no "Issues in Epic" yet, there is no way to create new stories. The menu option does not exist and the table does not exist. However I can create a subtask for said epic. Creating a subtask for a epic seems silly and probably shouldn't be allowed.

Suggestion: Include the epic in the title for stories and sub tasks, ie Project / Epic 182 Implement Project gen / 336 issue 2", where "Epic 182 Implement project gen" is the epic story.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When configuring an agile board with a project that has a custom workflow, the statuses in the workflow are available to be located into columns as desired by the user.  However, if the agile board's filter is updated to use a "text ~" clause, valid statuses within the filtered results are no longer available and may not be mapped into columns.  Instead, the column configuration appears to revert back to statuses from the default greenhopper workflow, even when those statuses are not part of the project's workflow.

If the columns are configured with the right statuses prior to adding the "text ~" clause, the issues will appear properly within the columns.  However once the clause is added, in column configuration the yellow triangle warning symbol will appear along with an indication that the status is not available despite a non-zero count.
fields.summary: Custom workflow statuses are unavailable when Agile Board filter includes a "text ~" clause

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

* Combine the work log into the comments on the detail view of the issue
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I would like to see the Work Log in the detail view of an issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the hour burndown chart is very granular, showing a point for every work log or RTE change at every hour of the day. This is sometimes useful combined with the interactive hover information when we need to quickly assess which issue affected the burndown. 

Most of the time though, it is too granular and detracts from the real day-to-day use for this chart: to see quickly assess the state and health of the sprint.

Compared with the classic burndown chart, where there was only one data point per day, the new charts look very cluttered and all over the place. 
*It's not possible anymore to have nice looking sprint burndowns because we would have to distribute our work logs all around the clock*, which obviously doesn't reflect how we work in real life.

*We'd like a version of the burndown chart with one data point per day,* just like the classic chart.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like a less granular version of the Burndown Chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
For example, I would like to add the following columns to help us prioritize :

"Business Value"

and a custom column

"T-shirt size" that acts as a first estimate, made by non-developers (probably product owner). 

And a final column

"Estimated Priority"

Which is simply a multiplication of the first two. This way, the Product Owner can more easily spot quick wins : Small Estimation x Large Business Value or things we probably won't do : Large Estimation x Small Business Value.
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I would like to configure which columns to display on issues in plan mode

fields.description: It would be really great if in planning mode if the quick filters also filtered epics and versions. That way you can make a custome project board add labels to all the stories and then when you "quick" filtered based off label the planning board version/epic would only show if they had a story with that label in them. The same it works when you click on a epic today you only see the stories in the sprints that relate to that epic.
fields.summary: Quick Filters should filter epics and versions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It takes about 4.5 seconds usually.

It does about 461 property set SELECTs.

We should probably make this faster.
fields.summary: GHGoToBoard slow on JAC

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If you are someone using a Kanban board to manage a support queue, you may need to move an issue from one person to another.

If you have a Kanban board that has assignee swim lanes, it would be nice if you could reassign an issue simply by moving the issue from one assignee swim lane to another assignee swim lane.
fields.summary: As a project manager with a Kanban board, I should be able to reassign an issue by moving the issue between assignee swim lanes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The format in which we are publishing Atlassian Analytics events is incorrect. Event parameters which are often long, user-specific strings, are being attached to the event name, which should stay constant.

[~jrotenstein] to provide examples in an attachment.
fields.summary: Atlassian Analytics events are being published incorrectly

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently if a board has a huge list of Epics, there is no way to filter it down to a manageable.

This feature request is to add some sort of filtering option for Epics.
fields.summary: Add option to Filter Epics on Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: For now, when closing a sprint, the not completed issues are moved to the backlog. It would be a great feature to be able to move those issues to another sprint when closing the sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to move the not completed issues to the next sprint when closing a given sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to our documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Creating+a+Sprint

{quote}
Your new 'upcoming' sprint will be added to your board, below any other future sprints. If you wish, you can edit the name, start date and end date.
{quote}

It turns out you cannot edit the start and end dates, only the name. When you start a sprint, then you can edit the start and end dates.

Thanks!
Clarissa.
fields.summary: Edit the documentation on Creating Sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be really nice to be able to "group" Quick Filters in the Rapid Board, creating some sort of dropdown. Best solution would be similar to the filtering implemented now in the JIRA Issue Navigator's simple search.

*Background:*
- when you have to filter for a lot of projects and more than 3 team members, it gets very messy and cluttered, especially on smaller screens (covered by GHS-9272);
- at the moment Quick Filters have to be modified every time there's a change in the team or project priorities.
fields.summary: Allow user to configure Quick Filters that provide dynamic filtering by value for a particular field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the future, when the project templates plugin supports a callback into the original page the user was on, with GreenHopper now enabled, we should redirect there and create the project they wanted, instead of to our own welcome mat.
fields.summary: Redirect user to project templates plugin after GH is installed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Proposed changes (via [~jrogers] )
* always show column counts based on select option for column tally unit - same as column constraint options without the none
* additional option in config to turn on column constraints, show/don't show

* effort required in JavaLand to pass the column counts to column when no constraints are in use
fields.summary: As a user I want to see the column tally without choosing column constraints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-8091].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
There is a new issue which has come up which affects all issue collectors being served from https://jira.atlassian.com. Current analysis is the following.
# User is logged in to https://support.atlassian.com or https://confluence.atlassian.com. This means that the new Unified Login for Atlassian (https://id.atlassian.com) knows the User.
# User has never accessed https://jira.atlassian.com after the unified login process was introduced.
# User opens *their JIRA instance* and accesses GreenHopper.
# GreenHopper throws up a red banner saying Syntax Error for the script feedback.js.

h3. Analysis
The feedback.js download request from GreenHopper goes to https://jira.atlassian.com and is intercepted by the Unified Login and taken to the 'Merge Accounts' page (so instead of the feedback.js the html content of the 'Merge Accounts' page is downloaded)

h3. Workaround
Access https://jira.atlassian.com and complete the 'Merge Accounts' process. Once done, do a hard refresh of the GreenHopper window (CMD/CTRL+SHIFT+R)
fields.summary: GreenHopper Feedback Errors With an Active Atlassian ID Session

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Check against JIRA 6.0-OD-10
fields.summary: Need to check 6.0 HTML escaping

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Document for customers how to build GreenHopper from source

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: ADG GH: NWD labels to AUI labels

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great if we can have an option to edit the labels from GreenHopper, such as "Backlog", "Sprint" or any other caption.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the product labels (headers)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hey guys, when you create a sprint on a board and try to view the Velocity Chart, it displays the following message:

"There are no available sprints for this board."

It turns out the Velocity Chart is only available for Complete Sprints, and that's not documented:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Viewing+the+Velocity+Chart

Thanks!
Clarissa
fields.summary: Edit the Velocity Chart Documentation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, users will only need to have project administration role on the projects to be able to start sprint. It does not need other condition.

However, there are cases that user would only want certain status to be achieved before a sprint can be started. 

For example refer to the screenshot below:
!startsprint.png!

So as a recommendation, to imply some condition before the sprint can be started.
fields.summary: Fulfill Certain Condition before Sprint can be Started

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, there are no status indication on the Backlog and the Sprint column, it is only available from the detailed view. User would need to click every single issue to check the status and it would be a hassle for a large instance.

So recommendation is to have the status included in the issue backlog and sprint, shown below:
!status.png!
fields.summary: Add Issue Status information to Issues Sprint and Backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA and Confluence Applink (including the project and space mapping)
# Configure the external gadget in Confluence to accept _Agile Gadget_
# Add an Agile Gadget in the Confluence Space
# Change the Start or End Date
!date.png!
# Refresh the Confluence Page and the modification of the date changed to the default value
!refresh.png!

h4. Note
The same "Agile Gadget" in JIRA saved the latest changes.  Ie. If a user changed the start date, the same start date will be saved upon refreshing the dashboard
fields.summary: Agile Gadget in Confluence does follow the start/end date Configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Greenhopper looks bad on long projects names.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-8075].
  {panel}

According to ISO 8601 and NEN 2772 the week that starts on monday the 16th of august should be week 33 this year.
Greenhopper states this is week 32.

Therefore the bug is: week numbers are wrong

This is a problem for me because: It makes it hard to communicate about week numbers when different tools use different week numbers. Outlook 2010 does it right, why can't we? ;)

There may be more than one week standard out there that people want to use. Perhaps there is a good reason that Jira is currently not using the standards I mentioned. In that case this is not a bug but a feature request. In that case: please add a way for admins to choose the week numbering standard that they wish to follow.

to reproduce:
log in with admin rights for atleast one project
go to a project which you have rights for
click 'administer project'
click 'manage versions'
click the calendar for the 'release date'
compare week numbering with outlook 2010 and/or ISO 8601 and NEN 2772 numbering
fields.summary: week numbers in greenhopper are wrong

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to save a new or edited Context in the Classic Boards, a NPE is thrown with the below stack trace.

h3. Environment

* JIRA 5.2.8
* PostgreSQL 9.1
* Max OS X 10.7.5

Create or edit an existing context and save the changes.

The context is successfully saved.

h3. Notes

As this has been raised as a critical, do we have any workarounds? Additionally, this has presented in both OnDemand and BTF.

fields.summary: OOM when "Sprint was" JQL query was used

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Root problem:
The only way epics currently disappear in plan mode is by marking them as "Done" (Epic Status field). If a user closes an epic using workflow transitions beforehand though, the epic is made read-only, so marking an epic as "Done" after that will fail.

Why we are where we are:
When we originally discussed how we wanted to mark epics as done, we decided to use a separate field so we we wouldn't have to handle workflows. A separate field gets around all these problems, so was a good solution for the problem. In case of the workflow option we would most likely have looked at the resolution field only. If there is a value => epic is done, if it is empty => epic isn't done yet. We could have set that field instead, but it would have been unclear which resolution to choose from, plus it possibly would have made the issue inconsistent with the workflow configured for it.

Proposed change:
I still believe using epic status is a good solution, but we could improve the current functionality by *also* applying the logic mentioned above. So, if EITHER the epic status is "Done" OR the epic has a resolution then we regard an epic as done. Had we implemented this logic upfront we could even have gotten around the upgrade task that tried filling in epic status values for already resolved issues :)
fields.summary: As a user I also want the resolution field to be used to mark an Epic as Done

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be nice if the versions created for sprints from the classic boards could be converted into sprints for the new rapid boards. This request is mostly releated to preserving historical data, and to be able to analyze all historical data in one place. As I understand it, classic boards will be removed, and this results in loss of historical data. It would also be nice to be able to remove these virtual versions from the version list with all the data migrated to the new boards.
fields.summary: As a Classic user I would like my sprint versions migrated for use on the new boards
